message.content: This question requires knowledge about renewable sources of energy. A renewable source is one that can be replenished or naturally generated in a short period of time, unlike fossil fuels which take millions of years to form. Option (C) refers to the sun, which is a renewable source of energy as it provides us with solar energy. Option (A) is incorrect because electricity from coal power plants is generated using a non-renewable source (coal). Option (B) is incorrect because oils made from whale blubber are not a commonly-used renewable source of energy. Option (D) is incorrect because gasoline made from fossils is derived from non-renewable fossil fuels.

This question tests the understanding of renewable sources of energy. A renewable source is one that can be replenished or reused in a relatively short period of time. Option (C) is the correct answer because the yellow dwarf star closest to us is the sun, and solar energy is a renewable source. Option (A) is incorrect because electricity from coal power plants comes from burning a non-renewable fossil fuel. Option (B) is also incorrect because oils made from whale blubber come from animals and are not a sustainable or renewable source of energy. Option (D) is incorrect because gasoline made from fossils is derived from non-renewable fossil fuels.

This question requires knowledge about renewable sources of energy. A renewable source is one that can be replenished or regenerated over time, so options (A), (B), and (D) are incorrect because they rely on finite resources that cannot be easily replenished. Option (C) refers to the sun, which is a renewable source of energy because it continuously produces sunlight that can be converted into electricity.

This question tests knowledge of renewable energy sources. A renewable source refers to an energy source that can be replenished or is naturally replenished. Option (C) is the correct answer because the yellow dwarf star closest to us refers to the sun, which provides solar energy that can be harnessed as a renewable source. Option (A) is incorrect because electricity from coal power plants is derived from a non-renewable source (coal) which is finite. Option (B) is incorrect because oils made from whale blubber is also a non-renewable source as it relies on hunting and killing whales. Option (D) is incorrect because gasoline made from fossils is derived from non-renewable fossil fuels.

Option (A) is incorrect because coal is a non-renewable source of energy. Option (B) is also incorrect because whale blubber is not a renewable resource. Option (D) is incorrect because gasoline made from fossils is derived from non-renewable sources. Option (C) is correct because energy from the sun, which is a yellow dwarf star, is a renewable source known as solar energy.

Option (C) states that energy from the yellow dwarf star closest to us (which is the sun) is a renewable source. The other options are not renewable sources.
